exercise.instructions: In the previous exercise we learned how to use single line comments. So what if we want to comment out multiple lines? One way is to start every line with a '#'. In addition, Python allows us to comment out a section of multiple lines by putting ' """ ' at the beginning and the end of the section.
exercise.code: def printName(name): print #enter your code here """ enter your comments here """ return

hints.hint: Use ' """ ' at the beginning and the end of the section you want to comment out

exercise.chatbotinitmessage: Great! now you know how to use all sort of comments!
